Title: How to prove an Inequality
Content: I'm beginner with proofs and I got the follow exercise: Prove the inequality $$(a + b)\Bigl(\frac{1}{a} + \frac{4}{b}\Bigr) \ge 9$$ when $a > 0$ and $b > 0$. Determine when the equality occurs. I'm lost, could you guys give me a tip from where to start, or maybe show a good resource for beginners in proofs ? Thanks in advance.
